docs.abstract: What looks like a big giveaway to wealthy stockholders is, in fact, exactly that.
docs.snippet: What looks like a big giveaway to wealthy stockholders is, in fact, exactly that.
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican candidates have pretty much stopped talking about their party’s only major legislative achievement under Donald Trump, the 2017 tax cut. Ads touting the tax law have largely vanished from the airwaves. But the Koch brothers — big boosters of the cut and among its biggest beneficiaries — haven’t given up.

headline.main: Apple and the Fruits of Tax Cuts
headline.print_headline: Apple and The Fruits  Of Tax Cuts

docs.abstract: The technology giant continued its foray into Hollywood by hiring one of the biggest names in television to create programs for streaming.

docs.lead_paragraph: Apple and Oprah Winfrey have joined forces in a multiyear content deal, the company announced Friday.

docs.abstract: Antitrust is the nuclear bomb of regulatory moves, but at a moment when nearly everything in America seems contentious, proposals to break up internet giants are gaining support.
docs.snippet: Antitrust is the nuclear bomb of regulatory moves, but at a moment when nearly everything in America seems contentious, proposals to break up internet giants are gaining support.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A decade ago, when the greed and carelessness of the financial industry came close to destroying the American economy, the overwhelming response by politicians and the public was: Meh. Almost instantly, all was forgiven and forgotten.

headline.main: Why a Big Tech Breakup Looks Better to Washington
headline.print_headline: Big Tech Is Growing. So Is Public Alarm.

docs.abstract: The music streaming service said Apple used its App Store to undercut companies that compete with its own services, like Apple Music.
docs.snippet: The music streaming service said Apple used its App Store to undercut companies that compete with its own services, like Apple Music.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Apple’s powerful role as gatekeeper of the App Store has long frustrated the makers of apps who must abide by its rules or risk losing access to hundreds of millions of customers who own Apple devices.

headline.main: Spotify Accuses Apple of Anticompetitive Practices in Europe
headline.print_headline: Spotify Tells E.U. Officials Apple Is Not Playing Fair

byline.original: By Adam Satariano and Jack Nicas

docs.abstract: The first skirmishes have already been fought in what could turn into a tech cold war. “The game is on,” said the Netflix chief executive, Reed Hastings.
docs.snippet: The first skirmishes have already been fought in what could turn into a tech cold war. “The game is on,” said the Netflix chief executive, Reed Hastings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple and Netflix, for better and for worse, have changed how we spend our leisure hours. In the process, the two companies have upended old media habits and created new ones.

headline.main: Why Netflix Won’t Be Part of Apple TV
headline.print_headline: Netflix Out As Apple  Ramps Up Programs

docs.abstract: With smartphones, everything digital has been managed through screens. Now that all of our visual capacity has been captured, the tech giants are starting to build a less eyes-only world.
docs.snippet: With smartphones, everything digital has been managed through screens. Now that all of our visual capacity has been captured, the tech giants are starting to build a less eyes-only world.
docs.lead_paragraph: Smartphones were once the best thing to happen to the tech industry — and for a while, it seemed, to all of us, too. In the 11 years since the iPhone made its debut, smartphones have subsumed just about every other gadget and altered every business, from news to retail to taxis to television, ultimately reordering everything about how we understand media, politics and reality itself.

headline.main: We Have Reached Peak Screen. Now Revolution Is in the Air.
headline.print_headline: A Revolution Is in the Air, And It’s Easy on the Eyes

docs.abstract: At the Apple developers’ conference, it was striking how company executives danced around the tech backlash.

docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Sorry, Apple’s not sorry.

headline.main: Apple Shuns the Tech Industry’s Apology Tour
